website_summaries.verdict: Thick gel is spreadable not runny, making it the easiest to apply.
pros: Makes hairballs easier to digest after just a few uses
Contains ingredients that slow excessive shedding and keep skin hydrated
Thick paste-like gel is easy to apply
cons: Product has a lengthy ingredient list

customer_reviews.title: Best tasting hairball lubricant (not that I've tried it myself)
customer_reviews.text: Our little buddy started to sound hoarse one day and it got progressively worse--I called the vet and they suggested CatLax but after doing research, I thought we would try this one first and wow. It worked amazingly. Even for picky eaters!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Works for us
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves the taste of this gel he will just eat it right out of the tube. We originally purchased this to help him sleep through the night a little longer and it works. We give him a bit before bed time and he’ll be less active through the night and not wake us up as early as when he doesn’t have it. We tried to give him some of this to help introduce him to our new cat and it did not help with this. He was still very on edge. Recommend for cats who need just a little calming, but not for overly anxious ones.
customer_reviews.author: Destinie

customer_reviews.title: Helps with tail biting syndrome
customer_reviews.text: My poor cat was orphaned at 2 days old. He suffers from tail biting syndrome & is prescribed Prozak, I also use a Feliway diffuser. But he still has bad days where he rips the hair & skin off his tail. This product really helps on those days. I rub about 1/2 tsp. on his front feet, which he immediately licks off(he seems to like the taste) He relaxes about 5 minutes later. Sometimes he needs another dose in an hour or so... But this usually calms him for the rest of the evening. Easy to use, and much better price than bought locally(& it's not always available locally). Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Barclay

customer_reviews.title: hairball medicine
customer_reviews.text: This arrived puffed out. I had no idea what was wrong. When I opened it, it went pop and oozed out. My cat would not eat it. Put it back and tried again. The tube keeps getting bigger and bigger. I finally threw it away. My sister said something bad is growing in it. Very disappointed. The first tube I received was fantastic and my cat loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product was received in a tube that was bloated from the bacteria that was growing in it.
customer_reviews.text: Product was received in a tube that was bloated from the bacteria that was growing in it. It appeared as if it had sat in a very hot vehicle for a very long time. Replacement tube was the same so I'm guessing there whole supply was infected. In order to receive a refund I have to return the product. I can't return this mess. It exploded when I opened it with this horrible smelling gel. I can't find a contact number to actually talk to a person. Hopefully, they will read this and reach out to me.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: She licks it eagerly right off my fingers
customer_reviews.text: My Maine Coon loves this hairball gel as a remedy when she "gifts" me with a hairball. She licks it right off my fingers, tickle, tickle, tickle. Although she is groomed daily, you would not believe how much fur my Coon has, so unfortunately, there will be another hairball somewhere in the future. This product seems to push that event much farther into the future. It absolutely helps her, usually with only one or two doses.
customer_reviews.author: Thrifty E.

customer_reviews.title: Buyer be ware  cats can get sick from this calmer
customer_reviews.text: Cats sick and vomiting after 3 days use. Vet bill in excess of $150.00 . Now cats won't eat, lethargic and hiding bought this to calm them not nearly kill them and make them sick.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: I didn't expect to like this as much s I do
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect to like this as much s I do, but I do. My little female rescue seems to have a suitcase full of past live baggage, but she seems just a bit stronger every day I give her this. She licks it right off my finger. Chamomile is the main active ingredient!
customer_reviews.author: A. Sletteland

customer_reviews.title: Is this the same product as before?
customer_reviews.text: Updat with photos: Normally my cat loves this! She licks it up. She wouldn’t eat it. She took a little lick and refused it. Did the formula change? Or maybe I got a bad batch? Sad. I’ll have to find something else. :( The full tube is the one I received today that she won’t eat. The bottom tub is the one she eats. Clearly there is a difference in color and consistency.
customer_reviews.author: Kimcheepineapple

customer_reviews.title: Tube Swollen Up
customer_reviews.text: I got four tubes of the Chicken flavored and they were all swollen and when I opened one, the contents started oozing out on their own. My cat doesn't like it and before he loved this stuff. What's up with this? So I called the company and they were very nice, said they'd send me a refund but that lot# 042 had a problem and now I have to wait for a new lot to come out. My cat is furious. This is the ONLY hairball gel he liked, and he adored it.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Duluth

customer_reviews.title: This made a big difference in our cat who has ...
customer_reviews.text: This made a big difference in our cat who has panic attacks and gets irritable. We are a multi cat house and did not want to use the air born types of antianxiety meds. A pea size lump a day rubbed on her front leg has helped her not be as irritable and she stopped licking obsessively. Hair has grown back on her legs where she licked it off.
customer_reviews.author: LadyGreene

customer_reviews.title: Helpful for long haired cats!
customer_reviews.text: My long haired cat tends to get hairballs even with regular brushing and good quality food, so I sought out this type of product with the hopes it'd help alleviate the frequent cleaning up that I have to do. Thank goodness for this product, because man oh man did it make my situation way better! My girl actually knows the sound of the cap popping open, and will run in to get her special 'treat'. It's reduced the amount of hairballs she has greatly, and seems to help her pass the fur that she does swallow without issues.
customer_reviews.author: Cibby

customer_reviews.title: Takes a little time, like anything, but can be effective.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my two senior cats, 12 and 11 years old, The younger one you can hear her joints crack when she walks, poor thing! My oldest is just a huge boy, body-frame wise. After a few weeks of this, she seems to be moving around the house more, and started playing again! I don't give it to them on their paw, I either drop a dollop on their morning wet food or they lick it off my finger or the tube. My 2 younger cats get the daily vitamins (same brand) as a preventative. It's also part of our morning/nighttime routine. I have the subscription through Amazon, so I don't worry about running out.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey M Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Toxic waste product
customer_reviews.text: Pro: The Cats find it tasty. Con: The ingredients make this a very unhealthy product. Hydrogenated fats are just as bad for Cats as they are for humans. Hydrolyzed soy protein is currently considered carcinogenic. Do Cats want or need stearic acid, sodium stearoyl lactylate, Corn syrup, polysorbate 60, xanthan gum, methylparaben, propylparaben, or any of the other chemical crap that is in this stuff. I wouldn't feed this junk to a Dog.
customer_reviews.author: The Guru in NH

customer_reviews.title: Throwing in the trash
customer_reviews.text: My cat liked the smell and I put a small pea size amount on her paw to see if she would lick it off. About 20 minutes after she licked it off she stood up and her back legs were wobbly and she had difficulties walking. 30 minutes later she threw up. About an hour later she started to return to normal. It took about four hours before she was OK . Two weeks ago she was at the vet and her blood work was normal she is just very hyper. Her body definitely did not like this. Throwing this in the trash as I don’t want to kill my cat
customer_reviews.author: Marta C. Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Paw-Gel is as described, has a great cat flavor, and is great value for the price. It has helped my cat with hairball issues and may be helping with urinary tract issues as well. Still I am supplementing with other urinary tract support products just to be sure. As for the paw-gel part, my cat will not lick this off his paws at all! He freaks out when I try to administer it that way and ends up flinging the gel instead. So I just give it to him directly and he seems to love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: It's a good product
customer_reviews.text: My cat doesn't object to this product, which is good. I think it's doing the job, she's not working on a hairball since I got the last batch a week ago. However, AMAZON delivery folks are not the brightest light bulbs, and this order was left on my porch in the very hot July sun. If they have have the ability to walk up the stairs to my front door to drop a package, they also have the ability to either ring the bell, knock on the door, put the product in the shade on the porch so it doesn't spoil, etc. Thinking around corners. Heck, just thinking...
customer_reviews.author: Terri Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Tubes about to burst from pressure
customer_reviews.text: The last 2 orders I received were full of air. It was like it was full of compressed air. It was pressurized and when open it shot out 1/3 of the product. Someone needs to learn how to fill these correctly. Thank you. As you can see from my picture there is 1 normal tube and 3 tubes under pressure.
customer_reviews.author: martin

customer_reviews.title: good to have in the house but....
customer_reviews.text: the last 2 times that this product has been delivered, the tube has exploded. So either they're packing it too much with air in order to make it appear ful and then that air expands even more in the heat. Go buy this at the store- don't buy it here it ends up being a mess and trying to return is a pain. 2 of my 3 cats love the flavor. It does cut the puking down by 75%. For my 1 cat that doesn't like it, I put some on a q-tip and wipe it on a front leg so she's forced to clean it off.
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle McDonald-Berry

customer_reviews.title: Exploding Tube!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this product a couple weeks ago, it came pretty quickly, when it arrived the tube was very bloated, almost about to pop, we opened it up and the product just came pumping out of the tube, like there was a gas in the tube as if the product was rancid. With such great reviews we figured it was probably just a bad tube, so we tossed it and ordered a second which arrived quickly and upon opening it it really exploded! Nasty, won't ever order it again. Hope others have better luck with the product.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: My cats' favorite
customer_reviews.text: Both of my cats love this one, so this is our favorite. It's also opaque so it looks more creamy and less petroleum-y. Under list of ingredients, in this order: water, stearic acid, hydrogenated vegetable oil, soybean oil, natural chicken flavor, etc. It goes on and on, but there is NO mention of petroleum, so I'm okay with that. I don't know a lot about petroleum products, but I wouldn't eat it so why would I feed it to my cats? Luckily, this is also the hairball gel both my cats enjoy so I'm sticking with this one.
customer_reviews.author: SLB

customer_reviews.title: Hallelujah! They like it
customer_reviews.text: Hair inside the cats is an issue in this house... at both ends of the cats, and these felines hate all hairball goo... EXCEPT this one. They actually view this one as a treat and happily lick it off my finger, then ask for more. That has never, ever happened before. One was a little weirded out by the texture initially, but because the other cat loved it, his jealousy took over. It is really nice to not have to fight about it, and both cats are "regular" as can be.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cat approved!!
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats, and one of them (the fluffiest of them both) has always been difficult when it came to hairball related gels. I ALWAYS had to put the gel on her paw when she was distracted, because let me reassure you: If she even caught a glimpse, then all bets were off. So I decided to try this one, due to the mostly positive reviews, and as you can see in the video attached, this one’s a winner!!! Both my cats loved it!!! My pickiest was even asking for more! Totally recommended and what a great price! The last gel I bought, was almost $20!
customer_reviews.author: Sofia

customer_reviews.title: Cat eats it without a fuss
customer_reviews.text: It gets an A+ for being able to get it in my cat without a fight. That is half the battle folks. I just mix it with his wet food. Now for the questionable part... I don't think it is helping him. I have been giving it to him twice a day for several weeks now with no improvement. I do not expect it to be a cure-all miracle for my cat's new arthritis symptoms so I am not going to give it a bad review. I'm sure it works for some and not for others.
customer_reviews.author: Webb

customer_reviews.title: I am extremely satisfied with this product
customer_reviews.text: I am absolutely thrilled with this product! After reading the reviews, as well as a family member recommending this for my cat, I ordered it. My cat was having urinary issues, and as an owner of a large population of house pets, I wanted to try this product before taking her to the vet (I spend a small fortune on my pets regularly). My cat improved within 24 hours! She also LOVES the taste of the salmon formula and inadvertently bit my finger when she was eating it from my hand. She saw the tube today and came running! I am extremely satisfied with this product, as well as the very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: M. Shemesh

customer_reviews.title: Careful! Product explodes
customer_reviews.text: I’ve heard that this product is actually really helpful for those pesky hair balls. However I did read some reviews that people were getting containers that were exploding. I decided to give it a chance and see if I could get a normal one. Nope. My tube came hard and bloated. And when I removed the seal the product exploded out! It sounds like these products aren’t being stored correctly. Needless to say I requested a return and I’ll try and find this product elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Aliddel

customer_reviews.title: My cats love it....
customer_reviews.text: After spending over $1,200 at the vet for our older kitties urinary crystals and a blockage that could have killed him? We decided to take more proactive measures to ensure this doesn't happen again. Make cats are notorious for developing crystals and blockages. My 5 kitties LOVE the taste. I just put a dab on one paw and let them do the rest! Seems to be helping because I've had no issues since I stayed using this. Also changed to Iams urinary care cat food and that helps too. I treat them twice a week with this gel.
customer_reviews.author: carol

customer_reviews.title: More Affordable On Here Than In Stores
customer_reviews.text: Recently had one of my cats have a urinary tract issue and was recommended to try something like this to keep him healthy. He's a bit picky, so I was worried about him disliking the flavor, but he loves it. As soon as I grab it and pop the cat, he appears! He doesn't like it on his paw, so I put a streak of it on a plate or inside a Kong toy to keep him occupied. Also much better value purchasing them on here vs in stores, I was paying like $7 for one tube in store!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle and Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it
customer_reviews.text: So I'm only on day 2 so I may be jumping the gun here but I have a senior kitty who has always been a vomiter. No matter what dry food we tried, he'd always throw up big piles of it after eating. Now in his later years he's steadily becoming thinner. Without really knowing where to start I ordered this to try and help him keep his food down and so far no vomit! Day 1 was rough getting him to eat it but tonight he ate it right out of the bottle (after his sister showed him how delicious it was)! So far I'm happy. Will update if I run into any issues.
customer_reviews.author: cmb8280

customer_reviews.title: defective
customer_reviews.text: I opened the package today to give to my cat. The contents appeared to be under pressure. When the seal was removed the contents spilled out of the container. It appeared to be under pressure. It seemed to me, to be possibly contaminated, and bacteria caused it to become under pressure. Needless to say I did not give this to my cat. I realize that i did not use this as soon as I purchased it. Sorry for the poor review. Thought you had to know.
customer_reviews.author: Lorry

customer_reviews.title: My cat would eat this for its entire meal if I let it
customer_reviews.text: Because I go through a lot of it and I'm not exactly rich I wish they would leave the price at the lower price it would be so much easier for me because my cats think it's candy and I have no problem getting this into their mouth they eat it right out of the tube so this gets a 10 plus rating from me and my cat in 4 years I've only cleaned up to hairballs I still do have an issue with only being able to buy five tubes when the price is low I would like to hear a fact can be changed
customer_reviews.author: BIZZY M.

customer_reviews.title: Saved my friends life
customer_reviews.text: if you’re wondering if this might help your cat with it’s bladder problem or if it’s having a difficult time trying to use the bathroom stop second-guessing yourself and buy it and get it shipped to you ASAP Will save your cats life if they’re having an issue with there bladder It saved my buddies life!
customer_reviews.author: Ironeagle

customer_reviews.title: My cat doesn't like it.
customer_reviews.text: My boy cat doesn't like the malt flavor or this stuff but he's the long hair causing both of them to puke (they groom each other). My girl is a short hair and didn't have issues before but I would give her some of the malt flavored oil laxative. She loves it. She also likes this. With either flavor I have to hold the boy like a baby and kind of just push the tube in his mouth. Basically force feed the poor guy. He does fine with it but I hoped he would like this flavor. He's otherwise not picky.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Wayne

customer_reviews.title: my cats wont get near this stuff
customer_reviews.text: None of my four cats will even get near this, if I open the tube near them they actually walk away pretty fast. Tried putting it on the cat that needed its paw, but she just wiped it off on the carpet. Tried mixing it with their favorite wet food, they took one sniff and walked away from the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Delialefay

customer_reviews.title: Spoled/Sour Product Received TWICE
customer_reviews.text: The first time I purchased this product it came in great condition and worked well for my cat. The second time I ordered it, it came to me smelling AWFUL and sour, so I could tell it was spoiled. It also looked like the bottle had been puffed full of air. I figured it could just be a one time thing and had them send me a replacement bottle. Unfortunately, the "replacement" bottle was also the same way - spoiled/sour, smelled horrible, and the bottle was full of air. Very unsatisfied with this product, which is so sad because it was working great.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Love this product!
customer_reviews.text: My new kitty is pretty spastic and is always trying to play with my other cat, and when I say always I mean ALL THE TIME! I give it to my kitty about an hour before I go to bed and it works like a charm, plus I feel good giving him something with natural ingredients. I have given it to him during the day a few times but it does make him sleepy so I try to only use it at night or only use a small amount during the day. He eats it right out of my hand.
customer_reviews.author: MacKenzie Conran

customer_reviews.title: Chronic UTI boy doing much better
customer_reviews.text: I have to give my boy steroids daily and if I surround the pill in this goop he mostly gobbles it right up. Occasionally he seems to get too much of a whiff or something and runs off to lick his face, but always comes back for more. Potent scent. But my guy also has chronic UTI issues that we recently discovered. We changed his dry food as well so hard to pinpoint which change is most effective but we give him this every day and between the two changes, no more UTIs since May and a much more normal litter box.
customer_reviews.author: afK2

customer_reviews.title: So far so good...
customer_reviews.text: The last couple weeks my darling cat was going on a hairball escapade, and it needed to come to a stop. She seems to enjoy the taste of this, I just put it straight in her bowl. She looked at me in discuss when I first applied it directly to her paw, as the instructions said. I have to say, I have not seen a hairball since I ordered this *knock on wood*. I give her some of this about 2 times a week. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: missyme

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Shake Off Their Paws
customer_reviews.text: So far, I think this is good stuff. What I like about it, is that it is at a consistency that my cats can't shake it off of their paws. It has a creamy consistency that really smooshes into their fur, so they HAVE to lick it off. I just got this, so I'm not sure how well it keeps the hairballs at bay yet, but at least I know that with this one they are actually getting it down them, instead of me cleaning it off of the fronts of my lower cabinets.
customer_reviews.author: Hydrangea Butternut

customer_reviews.title: My cat is AFRAID of this Stuff!
customer_reviews.text: My cat is rating this stuff. She HATES it! Not sure if it's the taste or smell or what. We kept it in the same place as her treats (kitchen drawer) and now she runs away whenever I open the drawer to give her treats (which is usually her main reason for living)! I love Misty so I through it away. I only used it about 5 times, but it got to be almost impossible to put it on her paws because she would fight me so much to get away. She's been Traumatized by this stuff! It will take months before she trusts me not to give it to her anymore I'm sure. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Burwells

customer_reviews.title: the tube exploded!
customer_reviews.text: When I got this tube it has a little plastic tab that you have to remove to start using it I was by the barrel when it happened and apparently this thing build up pressure When I remove the tab tens of the goo inside burst it out All over my walls all over my kitchen I don’t know if this tube was stored in a hot area? Or something but be careful opening the tube!!!
customer_reviews.author: Pamzylove

customer_reviews.title: Nutri-vet
customer_reviews.text: My cats wouldnt eat this . But normally they wont eat any brand. I found it to be very runny. When I would put it on my finger it would slide off. I tried putting it in the fridge and couldnt squeexe it out of the tube. I really wanted them to like it as the ingredients looked good for them.
customer_reviews.author: albert v.

customer_reviews.title: My cat got sick after eating the gel
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for year, it helped to control the hairball and my cat loves the flavor. I noticed recent tubes I received are all puffed up like chip bag on the airplane, and I can hear gas was released when i opened the seal. I also noticed the unpleasant smell after my cat started vomiting after ate the gel. I was wondering if they changed the formula or just the quality control issue.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Fussy feline likes flavor
customer_reviews.text: For a very fussy feline I opted for this product, to get the medicine down by applying to his feet. Pleasantly surprised he readily lapped up the test patch on his dinner plate. After 3 days of treatment he made it to the litter box more than 90% of previous week. Also recommend the 2pk blacklight sold here to find the source of problem. For my kitty urinary tract needed some support.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: MY 4 KITTIES TEEJAY, PUMPKIN,TEKOE & RUSTY CAN TESTIFY TO NUTRI-VET QUALITY/DELECTABLE FLAVOR!!!!
customer_reviews.text: AS I NOTED IN HEADING, MY 4 KITTIES CAN TESTIFY TO NUTRI-VET QUALITY/DELECTABLE FLAVOR!!!! ALL NUTRIVET PRODUCTS IN TUBE ARE EXCEPTIONAL QUALITY WHICH I HAVE BOUGHT FOR MANY YEARS. JUST SLOWLY APPROACH KITTY WITH CAP OFF TO LET THEM CATCH SCENT...THEN SLOWLY SQUEEZE APPROXIMATELY ONE INCH AS KITTY GINGERLY LICKS IT UP. ON AMAZON, IT'S A FAIR COMPETITIVE PRICE!!
customer_reviews.author: TeeKay

customer_reviews.title: This works for my cats!
customer_reviews.text: My two short-hair indoor cats have a battle with hair balls all year long. And they hate the smell and taste of every treatment I have purchased...until this one. No more having to chase them down to smear goo on their legs. They tolerate having it applied and then lick every bit of it off. And it works! It has dramatically reduced their incidences of throwing up, which is a definite plus. If you have a problem finding a hair ball remedy that your cats will tolerate, try this one. Wish I had tried it on my cats sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Charley

customer_reviews.title: Medicine my cat will actually eat!
customer_reviews.text: We've been trying different hairball medicine for our cat for a while, and he generally hates them all. It's a fight if we try to feed it to him and if we put it on his paws he flicks it on the walls and floor. Most medicines are a sticky gel that dries rock-hard, but this is more like a paste. He licks it up right away off his paws and for the first time ever the other day he licked up off my finger, willingly! We'll see over the long term if this is as effective, but right now I'm just excited to find something he will actually eat.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Cat hates it
customer_reviews.text: My cat won't even touch the stuff. I've tried it on his paw, with his favorite cat treats, mixed in with wet food, pretty much everything I can think of. He won't even sniff it. Normally he's a wet food fiend but he wouldn't even get close to his normal wet food once I mixed it with even the smallest amount of this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Storm

customer_reviews.title: REALLY HELPED!
customer_reviews.text: My cat has suffered from hyperesthesia for years but recently his symptoms became worse. He started becoming scared of things and acting strange and unsocial. I wanted to try something natural before having to possibly putting him on antidepressants. This had good reviews so I thought Id try it. To my surprise, it helped after very first use!!! It seems to help calm him and he is being social and acting more like himself again. He still has symptoms and probably will for rest of his life and maybe one day I will have to put him on meds but as long as this helps in any way, I will continue to buy it. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Marvin

customer_reviews.title: Be careful if the tube appears very full and tight!
customer_reviews.text: My cat seems to be fine with the taste, so that makes this stuff worth buying. I've tried the "Laxatone" gel for awhile and it is a battle to get him to eat that. My only complaint, and I am hoping this was a fluke, is that the tube I received was highly "pressurized". I opened the lid and the contents came pouring out uncontrollably... lost about 1/3+ of the tube on the kitchen counter and flour ... arg!!! I salvaged as much as I could into a container so that I wasn't throwing money down the drain... but geez! What a mess! I'm hoping this wasn't an indication of anything being wrong with the stuff...
customer_reviews.author: Seattle Mama

customer_reviews.title: Cat likes it!
customer_reviews.text: Watch yourself around my big Tabby cat if you have this on your fingers! He loves this so much, he is very enthusiastic when licking it off my finger that he might nip me by accident. I don’t put it on his paw because one of my other cats will try to lick it off and that doesn’t bode well for said other cat(s)!! I can’t say whether this is effective for urinary issues, as I am using it as a prophylactic, not a treatment. At any rate, it is a harmless treat that the cat truly enjoys.
customer_reviews.author: ebaygirl

customer_reviews.title: Cats liked it at first but...
customer_reviews.text: THey curiously lick their paws a little but soon they got so sick of the flavor they were annoyed. (it does smell kind of like plastic.) On the trip back I couldn't use it at all, they were fed up with the smell. The rest will go to waste :( Pet Rescue Bach flowers and Calm from Pet Naturals from Vermont is way better and they love it.
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: She lives it!
customer_reviews.text: My cat has very fine, very soft hair with which she has a lot of trouble. I have tried all kinds of products and food. She turned her nose up at everything and scratched me when I tried to use different brushes in her. Finally, finally! Something she loves that works! She begs for it and I don’t have to listen to her choke all night anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne M. Martino

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: My cat had a periodic problem with constipation which sometimes meant a visit to the vet. They gave her a hairball gel that my cat didn't like and it was difficult to force into her mouth. I previously used NutriVet for another cat and it worked for her. So far, everything has been good for Heidi using NutriVet. She likes the chicken taste and will lick it from my finger. I think this along with changing her dry food to Iams indoor/hairball control has made a significant difference.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe everything you read
customer_reviews.text: I figured my cat may like this, same as some other reviewers', whereby they said their cat loves this stuff, that the cat eats it right from the tube. My cat couldn't run away any FASTER! I put some on his paw, and he was forced to lick it clean... but afterward, I got some extra dirty looks (above and beyond the usual dirty looks).
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: and he purrs and seems happier than he did
customer_reviews.text: My cat hisses and growls a lot and hides. Vet gave him amatriptaline, but it didn't do a lot. With this product, he still will hiss occasionally, but he comes out to be petted a little after I give it to him, and he purrs and seems happier than he did... and this is from a cat mom who has tried everything. Still searching for the perfect fit, but this product has helped a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Mikhaela y.

customer_reviews.title: not all cats will eat this
customer_reviews.text: My cat will not eat this stuff... and she's the one that really needs it. She refuses it from my finger and just shakes it off when I put it on her paw. Forget trying to put it on her mouth or anywhere else for that matter.. she just shakes it all off everywhere.. good news is, her brother loves it and licks it off all the surfaces it lands on. And then he chases me down for more...so. If you can get your cat to eat it, it works.
customer_reviews.author: rachel lehman

customer_reviews.title: For a picky eater she seems to like it just find
customer_reviews.text: Seems to help out my old cat's arthritis pain. For a picky eater she seems to like it just find. I put a little on her paw and she licks it up like it's her favorite thing in the world. When she is taking it daily she seems more active and willing to climb up and down the stairs more so I feel she is getting more activity as her pain is less than when she is not taking the Nutri-Vet.
customer_reviews.author: Carla Hurlbert

customer_reviews.title: Both my cats love it and it seems to help relax them.
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t tasted this product, but both of my boys love this! I give it to them as a treat almost every day. The directions say 1/4 of a teaspoon, so a tube lasts a long time. I squeeze out the product on my finger, and put it on their paw. They lick their paw like it’s the best tasting thing ever. And, it has helped with their afternoon brawling. They seem more relaxed, and happier after they’ve had their treat.
customer_reviews.author: SharonLicht1964

customer_reviews.title: Great Hairball Product!
customer_reviews.text: My long haired cat loves this hairball remedy! I do not need to force her to eat it or even put it on her paws to lick it off..I simply squeeze the recommended amount in a feeding dish and she happily licks it all. It's not thick and greasy like other products that have a petroleum base. Its a soft cream. Definitely get this for your cat!
customer_reviews.author: Audie

customer_reviews.title: Something wrong with product
customer_reviews.text: Something seems wrong worth the product. It looks bloated? Like maybe exposed to too much heat... cat still likes the taste but I don’t think I will reorder. I will send back
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat with a very sensitive stomach, I tried a few different brands of hairball treatments, most didn't work as described and others he would just turn his nose up at them. This one however, not only does it work well and now he's only bringing up tiny little hairballs once every 4-6 months but he loves this stuff. I've nick named it it kitty crack, he'd eat the whole tube if I let him! I give it to both of my cats.
customer_reviews.author: Kim H

customer_reviews.title: The last 2 months of subscription ( 6 itens ) They used to love that..
customer_reviews.text: I been buy this product for almost a year and I got even a subscription but I notice that the last 2 batches 3 itens each month is very different and my (5 cats) doesn’t like to eat them anymore... really sad cause I will need to find another brand now on... I don’t like to right bad reviews but I’m afraid that this product coming now is not longer healthy to my pets.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: side affects
customer_reviews.text: after using this product for 3 days, my cat is now very violent and I can't even pick her up without her fighting and biting and scatching me. Her whole personality has changed. It has been a few days since I last gave it to her and her violent behavior has not changed. In the past she has never behaved like this. I am very upset and may have to put her down if her behavior doesn't improve. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cat likes it and it works!
customer_reviews.text: I have a very finicky cat who has issues with vomiting and hairballs. I was looking for something chicken-flavoured because chicken is something she has difficulty resisting. She loves this and will even "ask for it". I keep it on my desk and she will jump up and knock the tube over to let me know "it's time". When we use it regularly, she doesn't typically have any issues with hairballs or vomiting. I was even happier that this doesn't contain petroleum product and that it is MADE IN THE U.S.A. I'm glad that it is available and cheaper on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Serenity

customer_reviews.title: Cat had ZERO interest in this stuff. We tried ...
customer_reviews.text: Cat had ZERO interest in this stuff. We tried even hiding it in his canned food to trick him into eating it... I guess he’s smarter than me because he ate around it.
customer_reviews.author: Allie548

customer_reviews.title: cancelling my autoship!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed! 3 of the 4 containers are about to explode! Swollen, hard, unable to compress and product leaking out the "sealed" end! Unable to give 0 stars
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Spoiled cats unimpressed.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to use this for a stressful move but my two cats wouldn't try it. One even tried to bury it like it was poop. C'mon. I am sure they would give it zero stars, the picky adorable little jerks. This is the second edible "calming" product they have completely turned their kitty noses up at. I ended up getting feliway wipes for their carriers, which doesn't require making them ingest anything.
customer_reviews.author: Vermilion

customer_reviews.title: Cats love the flavor
customer_reviews.text: Our cats LOVE this product. My one ‘girl’ comes and lays on me when I am in the room reading and consistently stares at the nightstand until I give in and give her what she considers a ‘treat,’ then she happily goes and lays down on the bed. Once the lid is pushed open the other two coming running as well and it’s a race to see who gets the most! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Tupper's View

customer_reviews.title: My Cats Love It
customer_reviews.text: My cats ask every morning for this. They know they receive some each morning, and they will run into the kitchen ahead of me to ask. The cat who doesn't like it has more hairballs, but the two who regularly take it have no problems. I have been using this for years and will continue to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie E. Davis

customer_reviews.title: 1 out of 2 cats liked it but...
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, the cat that I bought this for seems to hate it. I have to put it on his leg, so that he has no choice but to eat the stuff, but he will try to shake it off of his leg if he can. Even if I put it in his food, he would rather not eat his food, so that hasn't worked either. My other cat seems to like it, but he's a shorthair and doesn't have problems with hairballs so it's not a complete waste, but it's still disappointing that this one didn't work out for the cat that needs it.
customer_reviews.author: TINA

customer_reviews.title: Forces grooming which helps in itself
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing. I love that you put it on the cat's paws which makes them groom themselves which is a calming action anyway. I have noticed a difference in my cat who was a rescued feral kitten who wants to go outside constantly. He isn't perfect yet, but this gel has helped.
customer_reviews.author: SiaSynn

customer_reviews.title: MESSY
customer_reviews.text: My cat seemed to like it when it didnt just slide off of his paws but I didn't like finding big globs of peanut butter- like substance ( it's just like peanut butter) everywhere. Maybe if it were clear, I wouldn't be so worried about staining. Personally I wouldn't be bothered with it again between how messy it is and how much I think it's stinks.
customer_reviews.author: Zoë

customer_reviews.title: Consistently works to get my cat to take her (crushed up) medicine
customer_reviews.text: This is the only product that consistently works to get my cat to take her pill (I smash it and blend it into the paste). She especially likes the salmon flavor. I think it smells horrible, but can smell it from two rooms a way and always enjoys it. Note that after it's been open for a few weeks, the potency seems to wear off (based on my cat deciding it's less interesting), so make sure you push the cap closed tightly. Both Pet-Ease and Hairball gels seem to work equally well, but I prefer the Pet-Ease as my cat's a little high-strung so every bit of calm helps.
customer_reviews.author: Mazzobabs

customer_reviews.title: Works great. No petroleum jelly. Consistency of toothpaste.
customer_reviews.text: This product works but doesn’t stick as well to the paws. Gotta get it in there. No petroleum jelly if that’s a concern. Thought my cat would go for it cuz of the catnip but no I still had to slather it on the paws. My other cat is allergic to chicken and I didn’t realize this had that in there so it’ll be for the one cat. Tried 3 different types and my favorite was the Cat Lax. This one is great if you don’t want one with the petroleum jelly and your cat can handle chicken.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for sensitive stomachs - poop issues!
customer_reviews.text: I had hoped this would help my Siberian who doesn’t like any crunchy food or snacks (her sister eats greenies everyday to help with hair balls), but it just make her poop sticky, leaving her with bits of poo sticking to her bum which then got all over the house. This happened several times before we figured it out - it hadn’t happened before we used this product and hadn’t happened since we stopped giving it to her. She does have a somewhat sensitive stomach so this may not happen for cats with heartier constitutions.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Kitty loves it
customer_reviews.text: My cat won’t eat chicken flavored food. But, she’ll lick this off my finger. It’s suggested to put the paste on their paw and let them lick it off. It seems less messy to squeeze it on my finger. Update June 2020: the packaging has changed. Now the hole in the tip is smaller. It’s really hard to squeeze the gel out. I wish it was available in a different form. In order to get all of the gel out of the tube I cut the tube and put the cut pieces together to close it. There is lots left after it gets empty enough to not squeeze through.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Williams

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS
customer_reviews.text: I give this product to all three of my cats, one of which is a senior and used to throw up a lot. Since I have been using this formula for at least eight months now, it very seldom happens. And hairballs are pretty much nonexistent for all three of them. No more middle of the night wake ups to a hacking cat. I recommend this product as a human sleep aid as well !
customer_reviews.author: C. Lugaro

customer_reviews.title: Be careful
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure why you would ask me regarding flavor. I’m not gonna taste it. Ever. I will say that I now have two cats with projectile diarrhea. Not gonna continue to use and I underdosed both cats. Pretty sure neither has hairballs now. But there is poop everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Abonamust

customer_reviews.title: All nine cats didn't care for it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the salmon flavor for my mother's cats. Both cats and six kittens didn't care for it at all. They all like salmon, they all enjoy a variety of meats and dry food, but they had no temptation at all for the salmon flavor. Tried passing it on to the animal shelter, and their cats didn't care for it either. Hope it was just my tube came from a bad batch, but I am not inclined to try it again.
customer_reviews.author: Fatt

customer_reviews.title: Great way to give glucosamine to cats!
customer_reviews.text: My cat who is 13 love his salmon gel! He has arthritis that particularly flairs up with the weather gets cold and I tried several other brands of the glucosamine treats but he would not eat them. With this, I just place it on my finger and he licks it right off! I do notice a difference in his stride when he doesn't have it so it's now a daily treat for him.
customer_reviews.author: Sallymanderkins

customer_reviews.title: The produce was spoiled
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this product. Everything was fine and my cats loved the produce last time. However, this time purchase was spoiled. The product arrived swallowed and the gel exploded the moment I open the seal. Lots of gel were exploded and made a mess. In addition, the gem smelled so bad that even my cats ran away from it.
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Cat approved
customer_reviews.text: My cat really likes this gel. She will eat it off my hand or straight out of the bowl if I put it on top of her normal food. I believe it's making a difference because if I don't give it to her for a couple of days she does do the "hacking" behavior like she has a hairball building up.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Cat thinks it's nasty, so does husband.
customer_reviews.text: I did not tell my husband to taste this stuff, I swear. But when our cat repeatedly looked deeply unhappy about this crap we were putting on his paws to help his UTI symptoms, he decided to dab some on his tongue and declared "that doesn't taste like salmon. That tastes like a bunch of chemicals." Eww. We will not be purchasing this again.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Smith

customer_reviews.title: Worked well
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well. I give this to my cats a few times a week as stated in the instructions. Every once in a while we still clean up a mess of hairball but happens way less often and they don't seem to mind the taste because i just add it to their food.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi

customer_reviews.title: Most recent purchase was a greasy dud.
customer_reviews.text: Typically our 3 fur child lose their minds over this product, however the most recent purchase had a different texture—was more like a greasy solid instead of the normal creamy texture. 2 out of 3 cats refused to touch it. 1 reluctantly tried it and walked away—the product stayed in its greasy tube shape and fell off the back of the spoon. Maybe it was a bad lot or a change in formula. We had two brand new tubes (exp 04/2023) and both were this terrible greasy solid. Oy.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this stuff!
customer_reviews.text: My cat doesn't have hairballs. I think it's mainly because we periodically use this product. We call it his "medicine". He knows when I say that that he is going to get a little treat. He loves the taste. I squeeze a small amount out and he licks it off of the end of the tube. I only give it to him a couple of times a week. This tube will last forever! I've tried other brands. He didn't like the taste.
customer_reviews.author: Azile68

customer_reviews.title: Not for my two picky kitties....
customer_reviews.text: Did not work, my cats absolutely refused this product, on their paw, on their food, or via syringe.
customer_reviews.author: Phae

customer_reviews.title: Picky cats might not like it.
customer_reviews.text: My cats took one sniff and headed under the bed. That doesn't mean that it isn't a good product; I have no way of knowing if it works or not. I have tried a number of different brands and flavors. My cats wouldn't taste any of them. Your cats may be more cooperative.
customer_reviews.author: BKC

customer_reviews.title: Works for kitty arthritis
customer_reviews.text: My senior tabby cat loves the flavor of this and will eat it right out of the container. She moves more freely when I give her the recommended amount each night. The times I think I gave her too much is when she pukes. Overall, it's a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Heasha

customer_reviews.title: 2 of the last 4 subscription orders were spoiled, and had to be thrown away...
customer_reviews.text: Two tubes in my last 4 subscription orders of this cat vitamin ( I receive a tube on a monthly basis) arrived spoiled and swollen. One a couple months ago had exploded and the other, the latest to arrive, was so tightly swollen it was just about ready to pop. I would like refunds for these two, please. I give it to my cat daily and I, otherwise, like the product. Leigh, Hawaii
customer_reviews.author: Lei

customer_reviews.title: Restlessness sloved
customer_reviews.text: The cats love this. It's like crack to them. But it's the only way to calm then down at night so I can sleep. It doesn't drug them, rather it just settles their restlessness and the running at 90 miles an hour across my bed in the middle of the night.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Hilton

customer_reviews.title: Both Cats Refused to Eat it
customer_reviews.text: Both of our cats refused to eat this. When I forced it on the paw of the cat who has the worst hairball problem, she’d run off and rub it on the floor or shake as much of it off as she could. Back to the other brand, I guess; at least I know they’ll eat that one even if it doesn’t seem to completely cure the problem.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stanton

customer_reviews.title: Repulsive to Cats
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my cat's minor UT infection because it was advertised as very effective and good tasting so cats will ingest it with no problem. It had a horrible stench and my cats wouldn't go near it. There was no way at all to get my cat to take it - fortunately the infection went away naturally.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Seems to help
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for a couple of years now for my male cat. Sometimes he would meow when he was in the litter box and I read that they do that sometimes when it hurts to pee so I've been giving his this and he doesn't cry when he pees anymore so I think it must be helping. He likes the taste, he likes it off my fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria B Gray

customer_reviews.title: won't purchase again
customer_reviews.text: Should have taken A pic. But I opened the package and the bottle was blown up ready to pop. I took the lid off and it was still sealed but I removed the seal and this dang thing Exploded all over the samn kitchen amd it stunk aooo badly.. my fault for not opening it outside smh.... and again I shld have taken a photo but I had such a mess to clean up i just threw it away. Soo...ya... i would just go to the storw and purchase this product.
customer_reviews.author: lonna d.

customer_reviews.title: My Cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 cats and my newest addition is older and evidently had a hairball issue...so I bought him this product...at first I put it on his front paw...now he licks it off my finger...After about a week, I noticed he wasn't trying to cough anymore...(He never did cough up anything, but acted like it)
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca S.

customer_reviews.title: Exploded out of tube
customer_reviews.text: This product was filled to 150% capacity... Still not sure if it's all paste or air. There was literally so full upon arrival, as soon as I opened the lid, approximately 2 ounces of paste exploded out of the top. This review is soley based on the poor packaging and not the efficacy of the product. The latter is still to be determined.
customer_reviews.author: KeeganK

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed with the ingredients- nesty stuff. One cat that likes this kind of remedy and thinks it is a treat so he eats as much as you can give him didn't ask for more. Another cat hid, didn't like it at all. Getting back to their previous product.
customer_reviews.author: Tatsiana F.

customer_reviews.title: Louie Likes  It - - -
customer_reviews.text: I was cat sitting for grand daughter's cat, Louie, and he had some problems with coughing up the hairballs. After trying some of the chewable type remedies and another brand hairball gel, I decided to try the Nutri-Vet gel. Also it was on special that day!! I tried stirring in his food and then on his paw. (Not the same day.) He went to licking it off right away after finally locating it on his paw. It must also have a good smell as that's what got him interested. He didn't cough up any more. He has now gone home and I sent the gels along so he won't have future problems.
customer_reviews.author: Sherrill L. Arnold

product_meta.title: Nutri-Vet Multi-Vite Paw-Gel for Cats
product_meta.description: Style:HairballAs cats groom themselves they ingest hair which can build up and cause hairballs. Nutri-Vet Hairball Paw-Gel for Cats contains natural oils and lubricants that help reduce hairball formation in cats of all ages and promotes healthy skin & coat. This tasty chicken or salmon flavored gel is petroleum-free with no artificial colors or flavors.
feature_bullets: 100% All Natural Products, Made in the USA
Promote a healthy active lifestyle for your pet
Contains natural oils and lubricants that help reduce hairball formation
Tasty and easy to give on the paw or straight from the tube
Good for cats of all ages to help them stay active and vital
No artifical color, perservatives or flavors
Made by Vets. Craved by Pets.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
